question_sentence: Which environmental group faced being kicked out of a UN body overseeing deep-sea mining for allegedly disrupting research expeditions?
evidence: Activists associated with the group have been protesting against The Metals Company as it investigates the viability of deep-sea mining. Member states of the UN's International Seabed Authority have the option of removing Greenpeace's observer status within the group. To find out more, listen to The Week Unwrapped.

question_sentence: The US this week formally banned which mineral?
evidence: The Environmental Protection Agency issued a new rule on Monday prohibiting chrysotile asbestos, a cancer-causing mineral, in the United States. According to the EPA, exposure to asbestos leads to approximately 40,000 deaths in the US annually. "Folks, it's been a long road," but the "EPA is finally slamming the door on a chemical so dangerous that it has been banned in more than 50 countries," said EPA administrator Michael Regan.

question_sentence: UK lawmakers this week introduced a bill that would establish an independent regulatory body governing which sport?
evidence: Supporters of the bill say an independent regulator will ensure financial security and stability for clubs, as well as safeguard England's football heritage, with Prime Minister Rishi Sunak hailing it as "historic". Opponents claim regulation may hurt the English Premier League's status as the world's top domestic competition.

question_sentence: Cubans chanted what during protests in its second-largest city Santiago on Sunday?
evidence: Cubans took to the streets to protest against 18-hour rolling power blackouts and food shortages, showing rare public dissent in the communist country. It was the "largest demonstration" in Cuba since a 2021 "uprising" that was met with a "violent crackdown".

question_sentence: Which French singer faced a racist backlash following reports that they may perform at the Paris Olympics opening ceremony?
evidence: A culture row has erupted in France over media reports that the country's biggest music star could perform an Edith Piaf song at the Paris Olympics' opening ceremony in July. Far-right groups have claimed the Mali-born French citizen is "not French enough" for the occasion, while the organising committee of the Games has condemned the "racist attacks" on Nakamura.

question_sentence: Which US government department is at the centre of a budget battle between Democrats and Republicans?
evidence: As in past budget debates, the White House's immigration policies have produced a major disagreement between congressional Republicans and President Joe Biden. Democrats have been quick to accuse Republicans of "playing politics" with the DHS funding to "sow chaos on the border ahead of November".

question_sentence: The UK's shadow chancellor Rachel Reeves used what term to describe her economic plan for a potential Labour government?
evidence: Reeves defined the term as an increase in state control while taking free-market capital-controlling interests into consideration. She stated that it was "no longer enough" for the state to step in only to "correct the occasional negative externality".

question_sentence: The US Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) released emissions standards on Wednesday targeting which industry?
evidence: The EPA is aiming to curb the environmental impact of car emissions and say these new standards will "sharply reduce" the presence of greenhouse gases and other pollutants. The ultimate goal is to reach a 50% cut in vehicle carbon emissions by 2032 by promoting electric vehicle production.

question_sentence: Russian election officials declared Vladimir Putin the victor of their presidential election last Sunday with what percentage of the vote?
evidence: In an election considered a formality by many pundits across the globe, Putin was re-elected for a fifth term. For more international analysis, sign up to our Global Digest newsletter.

question_sentence: Where was a new national security law passed this week that gives the government broad powers to suppress all forms of dissent?
evidence: The new national security law, Article 23, is needed to guard against "potential sabotage and undercurrents that try to create troubles," particularly "ideas of an independent Hong Kong", said the territory's Beijing-backed leader, John Lee. The law takes effect on 23 March.

question_sentence: Which fruit in the US contains the most amount of pesticides?
evidence: Strawberries topped this year's "Dirty Dozen" list — a ranking of the fruits and vegetables contaminated with the most pesticides. Many of the so-called “dirty” crops grow close to the ground, making them particularly subject to pests.

question_sentence: Which global leader secured a fifth term in office this week?
evidence: Devoid of any credible opposition, Vladimir Putin received 87% of the vote in Russia’s presidential election this week, according to officials.

question_sentence: Roughly how many migrant encounters occurred at the US-Mexico border last year?
evidence: There were around 2.5 million migrant encounters at the US-Mexico border last year, according to Department of Homeland Security estimates. Amid a battle over a controversial immigration law, a new report shows migrants are substantially increasing the pool of workers in the US and could boost the economy by an additional $7 trillion over the next decade.

question_sentence: Which state will soon be blanketed by a rainbow of wildflowers?
evidence: California will soon be decorated with vivid wildflowers after drenching winter rains set the stage for a spectacular superbloom.

question_sentence: Which tech company received an $8.5 billion grant from the White House this week?
evidence: President Biden announced one of the biggest federal investments in US microchip manufacturing on Wednesday — a $8.5 billion grant to tech giant Intel. Currently, the US makes none of the most advanced kinds of chips needed for artificial intelligence technologies.

question_sentence: During which month are the Paris 2024 Olympics set to begin?
evidence: The Paris 2024 Opening Ceremony — the first to be held along a river — is scheduled for July 26. Amid the ongoing war in Ukraine, Russian and Belarusian athletes will not participate in the opening ceremony, the International Olympic Committee said Tuesday.

question_sentence: Which state passed legislation this week that would prohibit diversity, equity and inclusion programs at public schools and universities?
evidence: Alabama Gov. Kay Ivey signed a sweeping law that prohibits diversity, equity, and inclusion at public schools and universities. The law goes into effect on October 1.

question_sentence: Which event this week was celebrated around the world?
evidence: The first day of spring, or the Spring equinox, arrived for millions of people around the world this week. Many gathered at popular landmarks to partake in cultural and ancient traditions.

question_sentence: Stocks soared this week as investors cheered the Federal Reserve's decision to keep interest rates unchanged. How many rate cuts are still expected later this year?
evidence: Federal Reserve officials anticipate cutting rates three times this year even though inflation is above the Fed’s 2% target.

question_sentence: According to the 2024 World Happiness Report, what is the world’s happiest country?
evidence: The World Happiness Report is out, and once again the Nordic countries are humming along with the highest scores. Finland ranks first.

question_sentence: What is the name of the new home goods brand formed by Meghan, Duchess of Sussex?
What are the three sections into which Jamie Wyeth’s exhibition “Unsettled” is divided?
choices: “Ghosts and Ghouls,” “The Natural and Unnatural Worlds,” and “Haunted Houses and Disturbing Dwellings”
“Strangers and Specters,” “The Natural and Supernatural Worlds,” and “Haunted Places and Disturbing Spaces”
“Allies and Adversaries,” “The Mundane and Magical Worlds,” and “Creepy Corners and Terrifying Territories”

question_sentence: Why was the Republican presidential primary in Delaware canceled in 2024?
choices: The primary was postponed due to a natural disaster.
Nikki Haley, a Republican candidate, withdrew from the race, leaving only one candidate.
The primary was canceled due to low voter turnout predictions.

question_sentence: What is the unique aspect of the band “The Amish Outlaws”?
choices: The band members are all related and come from the same Amish family.
All members are former professional athletes
The band members perform in traditional Amish attire and cover a wide range of music genres.

question_sentence: Who was named Delaware’s Player of the Year and led the Delaware Sportswriters and Broadcasters Association’s All-State girls basketball team in 2024?
What are the proposed plans for the southwestern corner of the intersection at Route 1 and Route 16 in Milton, according to documents submitted to Sussex County?
choices: To develop a 265,000 square-foot amusement park and a 150,000 square-foot shopping mall.
To develop a 265,000 square-foot water park (indoor/outdoor with hotel and convention center), a 150,000 square-foot shopping center, and a 5,600 square-foot super convenience store with gas pumps.
To develop a 265,000 square-foot office complex and a 150,000 square-foot shopping center.

question_sentence: What are the three ordinances proposed by Councilperson Shane Darby to protect people from losing their homes over unpaid water bills in Wilmington?
choices: Prohibit Wilmington from including unpaid water, sewer, and stormwater fees in foreclosure pursuits against customers who occupy the homes in question; exempt elderly and disabled residents, as well as homes with children under the age of 5, from having their water disconnected for nonpayment of water bills; create an affordable water system.

Prohibit Wilmington from including unpaid internet and cable bills in foreclosure pursuits against customers who occupy the homes in question; exempt elderly and disabled residents, as well as homes with children under the age of 5, from having their internet disconnected for nonpayment of internet bills; create an affordable internet system.

Prohibit Wilmington from including unpaid property taxes in foreclosure pursuits against customers who occupy the homes in question; exempt elderly and disabled residents, as well as homes with children under the age of 5, from having their property seized for nonpayment of property taxes; create an affordable property tax system.

question_sentence: What is the name of the University of Delaware coach who has been criticized for his participation in certain strongman events?
What is the selling price of the most expensive home in Delaware, located in Greenville?
